channel.title: Tylers Project Blog
channel.description: Recent content on Tylers Project Blog

item.title: About Me
item.description:
Hey, I’m Tyler!

I am a Level 2 Software Support Engineer with HPE supporting the Zerto product. I’m currently learning to code and building cool stuff along the way. This blog is where I plan to document my projects and experiments.

What I’m Working On

  • Learning Python fundamentals
  • Building up my homelab with Unraid, Home Assistant, Unifi Networking, and more

Future Project Goals

  • Creating an AI workshop assistant using Claude
  • Building a Pi Bramble to get more comfortable in Kubernetes

My Setup

  • Server: Unraid with Home Assistant, MQTT, Pi-hole, InfluxDB
  • Network: Ubiquiti Dream Machine with various Unifi devices
  • Current projects: Dev blog, todo list app

Connect With Me

  • GitHub
  • LinkedIn

This site is built with Hugo and hosted on my Unraid server.

item.title: Building a Simple To-Do List in Python
item.description:
Project Overview

I built a simple command-line to-do list manager as one of my first Python projects. It’s basic but functional. You can add tasks, remove them, and save/load from a JSON file.

What I Learned

  • Working with lists and basic data structures
  • Reading and writing JSON files
  • Building a simple menu-driven interface
  • Exception handling (try/except blocks)

The Code

The app lets you:

  • View all tasks
  • Add new tasks
  • Mark tasks as completed or uncompleted
  • Remove tasks by number
  • Save your list to a file
  • Load a previously saved list

What’s Next

I might add features like:
